Looted_Solo.synopsis: Players find remains of Dark Justiciars in the Ketheric City and wonder what might have happened to them and what kind of armor are they wearing.

Looted.synopsis: Players find remains of Dark Justiciars in the Ketheric City and wonder what might have happened to them and what kind of armor are they wearing.
Looted.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD-Main_A3. goto -654.75, 10.00, 420.755. Talk to the Skeleton near the banner flag and torch

Looted_Solo_15.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo_15.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*

Looted_Solo_10.speaker: Player
Looted_Solo_10.text: To the dust! Die in filth!

Looted_Solo_0.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo_0.text: *You sniff the corpse like the gore-bound truffle-hog you are.*

Looted_Solo_5.speaker: Player
Looted_Solo_5.text: Try to bow in respect for the dead.

Looted_Solo_9.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo_9.text: *Your wicked heart won't mourn. Deaths are to be celebrated. Every one.*

Looted_Solo_13.speaker: Player
Looted_Solo_13.text: No use trying to figure out what happened a hundred years ago.

Looted_Solo_8.speaker: Player
Looted_Solo_8.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

Looted_Solo_6.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo_6.text: *You recognise the symbol of the Dark Lady - you know these uniforms.*
Looted_Solo_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player goes into a crouch, looks over the bodies

Looted_Solo_16.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo_16.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, a reviled order within Shar's priesthood - one whose rite of entry includes killing a cleric of Selûne.*

Looted_Solo_11.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo_11.text: *You recognise the symbol of your Lady. You know these uniforms.*
Looted_Solo_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player goes into a crouch, looks over the bodies

Looted_Solo_4.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo_4.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, an honorary order within the priesthood of Shar.*

Looted_Solo_1.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo_1.text: *Among the various fabrics, you recognise the unmistakable symbol of Shar, the Dark Lady.*

Looted_Solo_12.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo_12.text: *You see nothing special - just torn and faded velvet tunics.*

Looted_26.speaker: Narrator
Looted_26.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*
Looted_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Surveying a group of Skeletons clad in Dark Justiciar uniforms (in game objects exist).

Looted_54.speaker: Shadowheart
Looted_54.text: Dark Justiciar uniforms... these were Shar worshippers - the same as me.

Looted_46.speaker: Shadowheart
Looted_46.text: Dark Justiciar uniforms... these were Shar worshippers - her most elite warriors. Curious.

Looted_92.speaker: Player
Looted_92.text: Allow the expert to explore these bones a touch.

Looted_90.speaker: Player
Looted_90.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

Looted_86.speaker: Narrator
Looted_86.text: *You immediately recognise the symbol of the Dark Lady - and you realise you know these uniforms.*

Looted_75.speaker: Narrator
Looted_75.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, a reviled order within Shar's priesthood - one whose rite of entry includes killing a cleric of Selûne.*

Looted_10.speaker: Player
Looted_10.text: To the dust! Die in filth!

Looted_60.speaker: Shadowheart
Looted_60.text: Watch your tongue - these were my brethren.
Looted_60.context: NodeContext: Sharp retort (she's known to be a Shar worshipper)

Looted_17.speaker: Lae'zel
Looted_17.text: Enough. Whatever your petty squabbles, let them rot with these corpses.

Looted_108.speaker: Karlach
Looted_108.text: Better dead than stuck down here. Right?

Looted_82.speaker: Astarion
Looted_82.text: Don't be touchy. I'm sure they meant 'better off dead' as a compliment.

Looted_29.speaker: Wyll
Looted_29.text: Now, now. Take a breath, count to ten. This battle's been long-finished - no reason to fight it again.

Looted_34.speaker: Gale
Looted_34.text: Don't turn on each other. If whatever managed to murder a group of Sharrans is still around, we had better watch our step.

Looted_122.speaker: Shadowheart
Looted_122.text: I'm sure they'd consider the feeling mutual, if they could.
Looted_122.context: NodeContext: Terse. The player disrespected her dead Shar-worshipping comrades, but she's still keeping that part of herself a secret.

Looted_89.speaker: Gale
Looted_89.text: Maybe. But if whatever managed to murder a group of Sharrans is still around, we had better watch our step.

Looted_59.speaker: Wyll
Looted_59.text: Let's hope whoever killed them has long since marched on.

Looted_87.speaker: Karlach
Looted_87.text: Let's just hope whatever managed to plough through 'em is long dead, too.

Looted_114.speaker: Astarion
Looted_114.text: Some of us are dead and doing very well, thank you.
Looted_114.context: NodeContext: In response to 'Evil goddess worshippers. Better off dead.'

Looted_70.speaker: Lae'zel
Looted_70.text: And better off still than being skewered by the point of my blade.

Looted_103.speaker: Player
Looted_103.text: Try to bow in respect for the dead.

Looted_85.speaker: Narrator
Looted_85.text: *Your wicked heart won't mourn. Deaths are to be celebrated. Every one.*

Looted_125.speaker: Player
Looted_125.text: Whatever killed them, at least it rid the world of some of its evil.

Looted_81.speaker: Player
Looted_81.text: Something powerful killed them. We must be careful.

Looted_21.speaker: Lae'zel
Looted_21.text: Yes, we should press forward. These dead have no more tales to tell.

Looted_40.speaker: Shadowheart
Looted_40.text: As you like. Hopefully my own remains are treated with a little more dignity, when the time comes...
Looted_40.context: NodeContext: A little solemn (She saw some of her comrade's bodies abandoned where they died - she may or may not be known as a Shar worshipper at this point).

Looted_6.speaker: Karlach
Looted_6.text: I'll keep an eye out. If it's a demon, I'll be able to spot it a mile off.

Looted_102.speaker: Astarion
Looted_102.text: Agreed. Let's go, we have places to be.

Looted_27.speaker: Wyll
Looted_27.text: Let's get moving, then. Once we fill our packs with what we can carry, of course.

Looted_48.speaker: Gale
Looted_48.text: Let's not. But a word of warning: down here in the Underdark, few dangers ever truly die.

Looted_72.speaker: Narrator
Looted_72.text: *You immediately recognise the symbol of your Lady. You know these uniforms.*

Looted_118.speaker: Narrator
Looted_118.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, an honorary order within the priesthood of Shar.*

Looted_13.speaker: Player
Looted_13.text: I hope whatever killed them is still around. I will not have it soil Shar's name.

Looted_4.speaker: Shadowheart
Looted_4.text: Indeed. We will avenge them if we can. And who knows? Perhaps other children of Shar are still to be found down here...
Looted_4.context: NodeContext: Spoken to a fellow shar worshipper. They found the remains of some of their brethren in the underdark, long dead.

Looted_35.speaker: Lae'zel
Looted_35.text: Bah - let Shar exact her own revenge, if she's so inclined. Our concerns lie far elsewhere.

Looted_23.speaker: Karlach
Looted_23.text: I think the evil god of loss can avenge herself, if she needs to.

Looted_65.speaker: Astarion
Looted_65.text: By all means, avenge Shar, but can we do it later? The worm is more important than your piety.

Looted_22.speaker: Wyll
Looted_22.text: Let's come back to this later, yeah? We've got more pressing matters afoot.

Looted_107.speaker: Gale
Looted_107.text: Whatever it was that killed them, if it managed to murder a group of Sharrans, we had better watch our step.

Looted_119.speaker: Shadowheart
Looted_119.text: Quite bold of you to flaunt your Shar worship so openly. I hear that's ill-advised.
Looted_119.context: NodeContext: Knowing and pointed. Shadowheart is aware that the player worships Shar, but the player does not know the same is true of her when she speaks this line.

Looted_124.speaker: Gale
Looted_124.text: If it managed to murder a group of Sharrans, we had better watch our step.

Looted_51.speaker: Wyll
Looted_51.text: If their killer's still around, it's not Shar's name I'm most interested in saving.

Looted_91.speaker: Karlach
Looted_91.text: Be careful what you wish for, soldier.

Looted_0.speaker: Astarion
Looted_0.text: Don't waste your time hoping. It's probably long dead.

Looted_112.speaker: Astarion
Looted_112.text: Of course, being dead doesn't stop everyone in their tracks. But hopefully it's somewhere quiet, decaying peacefully.

Looted_37.speaker: Lae'zel
Looted_37.text: Shar's name is no more our concern than a gnat's egg. Turn your attentions to something of actual import.

Looted_58.speaker: Narrator
Looted_58.text: *Among the various fabrics, you recognise the unmistakable symbol of Shar, the Dark Lady.*

Looted_12.speaker: Player
Looted_12.text: Try to bow in respect for the dead.

Looted_95.speaker: Player
Looted_95.text: Whatever killed them made an enemy of a powerful goddess.

Looted_98.speaker: Lae'zel
Looted_98.text: Bah - let Shar exact her own revenge, if she's so inclined. Our concerns lie far elsewhere.

Looted_9.speaker: Karlach
Looted_9.text: Whatever killed a bunch of Sharrans might still be down here. Just saying.

Looted_79.speaker: Astarion
Looted_79.text: I'm sure Shar is powerful enough to take her own revenge. No need for us to get involved.

Looted_116.speaker: Wyll
Looted_116.text: Let's come back to this later, yeah? We've got more pressing matters afoot.

Looted_83.speaker: Gale
Looted_83.text: Still, if whatever managed to murder a group of Sharrans is still around, we had better watch our step.

Looted_64.speaker: Gale
Looted_64.text: Still, if whatever managed to murder a group of Sharrans is still around, we had better watch our step.

Looted_61.speaker: Wyll
Looted_61.text: Let us do what we can to avoid their fate, then.

Looted_63.speaker: Karlach
Looted_63.text: Whatever killed a bunch of Sharrans might still be down here. Just saying.

Looted_24.speaker: Astarion
Looted_24.text: Powerful enough to take her own revenge, I'm sure. No need for us to get involved.

Looted_94.speaker: Lae'zel
Looted_94.text: And she has since exacted her revenge, undoubtedly.

Looted_3.speaker: Player
Looted_3.text: I hope whatever killed them is still around. I will not have it soil Shar's name.

Looted_28.speaker: Narrator
Looted_28.text: *You see nothing special - just torn and faded velvet tunics.*

Looted_76.speaker: Player
Looted_76.text: No use trying to figure out what happened a hundred years ago. Let's focus on our problems at hand.

Looted_36.speaker: Lae'zel
Looted_36.text: Yes, we should press forward. But let's not presume the past always remains buried.

Looted_55.speaker: Shadowheart
Looted_55.text: As you like. But don't presume whatever killed them is a thing of the past. Some battles span centuries.
Looted_55.context: NodeContext: she's contemplating the ongoing hostilities between Shar and Selune's forces as she says this

Looted_31.speaker: Karlach
Looted_31.text: You took the words right out of my mouth, soldier.

Looted_100.speaker: Astarion
Looted_100.text: Yes, there's not much we can do for dusty old soldiers. Let's get moving.

Looted_41.speaker: Wyll
Looted_41.text: If we must. Oh, but imagine what tales these bones might tell if they could.

Looted_69.speaker: Gale
Looted_69.text: Down here in the Underdark, few dangers ever truly die.

Looted_33.speaker: Gale
Looted_33.text: Look at those uniforms. They must have belonged to some kind of sect.

Looted_50.speaker: Lae'zel
Looted_50.text: Unusually robust uniforms - warriors fallen in battle, perhaps.

Looted_39.speaker: Astarion
Looted_39.text: Cut down and left to rot. Such fine armour deserved better.

Looted_115.speaker: Wyll
Looted_115.text: Such handsome armour - a fighting force of some renown, perhaps.
